zhihao_1_intro: ^I dunno what to say about myself cos my life not very interesting, lol.
^I’m 18, I go to the same JC as Gavin. At first I wanted poly cos got all the chiobus there, and Aman is there also.
^Me and Aman stay on the same floor since P1. The whole floor only got both of us same age, so bo pian lor-- like or don’t like end up only can disturb each other, haha.
^Anyway, end up I go JC. Pa always wanted that for me cos then I got better chance to go uni.
^Two years ago, he passed away. The whole world came: His friends, his colleagues, his ex boss current boss all came to the wake. All say he was a damn solid guy. A star worker.
^They won’t get Pa this type of person again.
^But Pa always used to tell me, be your own boss is best.
^So I started my own business. I do game streaming on Twitch, now got almost 1K viewers. Tipping page all I also have. I set up on StreamXclusive, so when my viewers are happy they donate.
^Guess what. Lots of them are happy. Hah. The money is good and getting better and better.

^Last month right, I diam-diam pay off all the bills, buy the groceries for dinner – yah, I know how to choose these things, okay. The kailan, the sotong, all I pick sibeh fresh one. Ma got a shock, hah!
^Swee, man. It’s not much lah but you go ask my friends -- see if any of them can pay their house bills.
^It’s really not hard. The house only got me and Ma. Every night she will light one joss stick for Pa. And every night, I work on my business.
^So that’s my life lor. I’m Zhihao.
^And this is what it's like, to be me.
zhihao_1_1_narration: ^Ma and I are on the way to Chinese New Year lunch with my uncles. We are late, and I don't like them.
zhihao_1_1: ^Bai nian (greet them happy new year) to them for what. Bai nian also got nothing to say.
^Cannot say like that. Pa won't be happy.
^People want to louhei (a celebration activity for Chinese New Year) you think they wait for you ah.
^Aiyah, Ma cannot anyhow leave early. If office need to OT then I bo pian (no choice) have to OT mah. Later other people see me leave, confirm not happy will make noise one.
^We not just late, we kan pua (damn) late - got difference hor.
^Oi. First hor, you say don’t want to see your GuGus (uncles). Now you scared we late. You flipping prata ah, Boy?

s: ^Why you always like to be late?
^If Pa were here, we won’t be late.

c-0: ^Orh, so Ma’s fault lah? Want to geh kiang (act smart) point finger you ask yourself, just now whose earphones lost ah?
^And lost that time who help you find?
^I put them on the table hor. You the one anyhow pack, ownself forget pack where.
^Who teach you to talk to me like that? No respect for your elders!
^I never even ask you to say thank you, you still want to talk back. Since when you become like this? Since when I teach you until like that?
c-1: ^Ah shit. I shoot my mouth too fast.
^She looking at me liao. I better not look back.
^You want to get out of the car?
^You think I forget he not here issit?

^Not say I anyhow want to be late, okay. Just now I no choice got to OT, not like you like that, earphones anyhow throw end up come back still need to help you find. Find already you still talk to me like that.
^Don’t want to talk to you already, lah.
^Die already easy to say. See what people say when you still here.
c-2: ^Next time your earphones just keep in the same place. Just now if you know where you put we won’t be so late.
^I so busy already you know. Cannot always help you find your things.
g-0: ^OW. Wth I so old already she still smack me.
^People talking to you about one thing you don’t anyhow go change topic.
^Today will be a bad day. I can feel it.
^I know Ma wants to say something. But she won’t. Always like that.
^Faster help Ma take the orange from the boot.
^Haiyah just now you say we late already now still want to kaopei (kick up a fuss) car senget. Later you want your uncles to kaopei also issit? Faster go out take out the orange!

zhihao_1_2_narration: ^At Ji Gu’s (1st Uncle’s) house for Chinese New Year. Dua Gu (2nd Uncle) is here too.
zhihao_1_2: ^Wah. Skip CNY one year, now dunno who is called what.
^Ji Gu! Dua Gu! Xin nian kuai le! (1st Uncle! 2nd Uncle ! Happy New Year!)
^Wah! Ah Hah ah! Xin nian kuai le! Now you become so tall and handsome!
^Ah Hao! Everyone missed you! Every year hide at home thinkthinkthink not good for your mind, you know?
^Lol, I wanna hide also nowhere to hide.
^Lai, lai.  Come, come, go eat the food. No need shy.
^Last year, me and Ma had to skip CNY. When Pa passed away, we didn’t celebrate anything with anyone.
^Supposed to be three years cannot celebrate, but I think if we three years don’t go, end up forever won’t go.  So this year – second year – we just go lor.
^Yah, everybody know nobody want to say, but every extended family got one ji shi (cornerstone) to hold everything together. Pa was that ji shi.
^No ji shi, no house. Without Pa, we cannot connect.
^But I do miss the food lah...
^Aiyah I better eat this first. Eat no need to talk.
^Swee. Can take all the crackers for myself.
^Not like got cousin want to fight me for this.
^Hope nobody asks me anything if I keep eating.
^Wah lao eh, Dua Gu looking at me liao.
^Must study hard hor, Ah Hao. Make your Pa proud.
^You hear Dua Gu anot? Don't play so much computer. Everytime hide in your room play game, play until forget all your friends already.
^Nowadays got this thing called Internet, people can log on and talk to each other.
^Not good you know! Must go out more.
^Wah, Ah Hao so guai ah! Nowadays young people don’t follow their mother go temple one.
^No, no. He help his friend at the Indian temple. Good boy, that Aman.
^Why your friend take you go Indian temple?
^Sick must go see doctor, pray no use one!
^Haiyah you don’t talk anymore lah! Ah Hao, your friend Indian, correct?
^Wah. First time I hear. You always follow your friends issit?
^Wtf is he trying to say? That I dunno how to use my brain?
^Not say I follow. Friends must help each other lah.
^Help each other is good!  Ah Hao hen guai. (Ah Hao is a very good boy.)
^To Dua Gu everything also good. Jiak sai (eat shit) also good. Dua Gu, you good this, good that, end up all your words also sai ah!
^Ah Hao, you work at the temple, the pay okay anot? I worry about you, you know. If not enough Ji Gu can help you find better job. Easy one.
^It’s not work, I just help my friend pack donations for charity.
^Why you waste time!  Ji Gu teach you.
^Lai liao his nonsense lai liao. (Here he comes with his nonsense.)
^When you young that time must learn to make money!
^All your friends, they study so much go uni but then come out all dunno how to make money.
^My son, ah, he play computer can earn money, you know! Last month he pay off the utility bills. I want to pay also cannot ah!
^Ah Hao, you tell your GuGus about your computer. Ma dunno how to explain this kind of thing.
^Smart Ma, smart. Earlier what you say about about my gaming?

s: ^This kind of virtual thing how to make them understand?
^Dunno what Ji Gu will say if I explain. Aiyah forget it lah.

c-0: ^I show people how I play the games and I teach them how to win.
^Got a lot of players want to be my students or followers, so business is good.
c-1: ^I just teach people how to win games and they pay me lor.
c-2: ^No lah not say I really make money.

zhihao_1_2a: ^Wah issit? One month how much you make?

c-0: ^He thinking high or low? FML why I go shoot my mouth.
^Maybe four or five hours at night. Cos in the day I got school.
^Mei shi lah, Ji Gu. (It’s not an issue lah, Ji Gu.)
c-1: ^ Around $2000. Sometimes can go up to $3000.
^He’d better say it’s good money. Cos it’s good money... I think.
^If one month $0 then another month $3000 means your income very unstable!
^Like that very hard to plan your life. And you got school also.
^You say until like that ah, doesn’t sound like a stable job leh.
^You one week work how long? Every week the same anot?
^Most days are the same, but it’s up to me.
^So actually you can work more, lah. But because you still studying you cannot, right?
^Eh, Ah Mei! You want your son to work or study?
^Tsk, of course his studies come first. He can do both, he’s okay.
^Not good lah. If he must concentrate on school, you must find passive income.
^Mei shi lah, Ji Gu. (It’s not an issue lah, Ji Gu.)
c-2: ^Maybe four or five hours at night. Cos in the day I got school.
^Wah, nowadays one income very difficult one.
^Ma looking at me liao. Bo pian lah, Ma. If I talk more about my game business he’ll start trying to give me crap advice.

zhihao_1_2b: ^Aiyah, if like that ah, better rent out your place. Rent to two or three tenant lah. Like that money and time both also have.
^Our other room cannot put two people.
^Then take the biggest room lah! Ah Mei, master bedroom ho boh? (Ah Mei, is the master bedroom okay?)
^You take the smaller room, Ah Hao take his own room… bo boon dueh (no problem/ problem solved) lor!
^I want to tell her don’t waste time reply. That we can give excuse and zao.
^But then ah, I also want to punch him. Punch then zao. This guy sibeh kiam pa [asking to be beaten up] sia.
^Pa, I’m trying lah. I’m really trying.
^Ah Mei, if you don’t want to rent out is okay one. Renting not easy also.
^Good, Dua Gu feels bad about it.
^If you and your Ma want to rent your place, best you rent only to the Singaporean Chinese. Safest.
^You ask Ji Gu what happened, that time he rent his place to the foreigner. What country he from ah, Ji Gu?
^Country ah? India or Pakistan-- haiyah I can’t remember. Wah, that time I rent to him cos he promised to pay 20 percent more.
^Uncle that time kum gong (stupid)-- all my friends got warn me, never rent to foreigners cos they give a lot of headache. But I kum gong lor, only listen to the money.
^I tell him, okay, you can go everywhere, you can use everything, just cannot do cooking, cannot bring your friend stay overnight. He say to me, “Okay boss”, shake my hand.
^Then ah, not even one week-- lucky Ji Gu come back from work early-- I see the house so messy and the smell like spoiled food like that.
^That’s why we cannot trust foreigners. Not say Uncle want to criticise them, but is the truth.
^As long as they only do light cooking, like cook Maggie Mee, I’m okay. But if cook curry or use the oven then of course different lah.
^We where got oven. Also hor, don’t say other people cook curry. You also cook curry lor.
^I cook curry is not every day, okay!
^Aman’s mother make you the curry you still eat right.
^Aman is different. I know his mother so long, of course we exchange food.
^So if Aman’s mother rents our place, you’ll let her cook curry?
^You don’t mei da mei xiao (don't be cheeky) lah, boy.
^Your friend different! Singaporean Indian different. I’m saying the Indian Indians. Their culture too different from ours already. Cannot mix. You add fire and water together what happen, I ask you?
^Wah piang he really wait for me to answer.

^And they very hao lian (arrogant), you know. You think they see your friend as equal? They look down on Singaporean Indians like him. You don’t believe you can ask your friend – he got mix with the Indian-Indians anot?
^Of course not lah. I see this kind of thing so many years already. They won’t change one.
^Ah Hao, you still young, so must be careful what type of friend you help. Cannot suka suka (anyhow) trust anybody hor – don’t anyhow listen to Dua Gu.
^Remain polite and subtly refute Ji Gu.

c-0: ^ It’s okay lah, Ji Gu. I trust Aman with my life.
^But listen to me. Ji Gu is sixty years old liao, everything I also see already.
^What I tell you is the truth. And sometimes the truth is ugly.
c-1: ^  Ji Gu, I trust Aman. But Pa said sometimes cannot trust family to take care of us even when we are in need.
^OI! Ni bi zui ah, ni!  (You shut your mouth, ah, you!)
^Hahaha. Ah Hao is growing up fast.
^Ah Mei, don’t have to scold him. Boys are boys.
^He winked at me. Ugh. Forget it.
c-2: ^Maybe you don’t agree. But one day you’ll understand why I say this.
^Trust no one. Only look out for yourself.
^Wah lao he zim lor sor (very long-winded)

zhihao_1_3: ^I walked to the toilet, but halfway there I stopped and turned back to hear my ma and Ji Gu arguing.
^I don't think they see me, but I can overhear everything.
^Whenever they speak only Hokkien, it’s always something bad. Bad and complicated. They assume I don't understand, but obv I can.
^Didn’t you just say you don’t want to rent out your place? That means you have one extra room. Why Ba cannot stay with you?
^Do we need to discuss this now?
^Let’s not run away from the problem.
^The old folks’ home just restructured their fees and the subsidy brackets this month. I’ve always been very straight with you: $400 is the most I can afford. Our brother can only give $200.
^You’re telling me now you can afford the extra $450 to keep Ba there?
^Wtf, Ah Gong’s home fees increase so much? Why Ma always never tell me this kind of thing?
^I cannot say out loud, but I really dunno how it’s fair that Ah Gong is still here when his soul is long gone. Zero dignity.
^I can’t remember when Ah Gong stopped talking. But I remember our last convo.
^He thought I stole his comb so he threw his cup at me. His baby sip-cup. Then he screamed and called me names. And then he cried and cried and cried.
^He cannot talk anymore. He cannot walk anymore. He cannot eat anymore. He should have died long ago.
^I wish he died and not Pa.
^Why can’t Ba stay with you? You stay by yourself, you have three rooms.
^I have to travel to JB every two weeks for work, how’d you expect me to care for Ah Gong?
^We can all chip in for a maid –

^Siao ah! How is a maid trained to treat his bedsores, give him his insulin shots? And you think they’re okay with changing his diapers? Even the nurses complain he always fights them off and scratches them.
^Remember what I said about trust. Don’t ever trust maids to be left alone with  Ah Gong.
^I’m so busy already juggling a job and a kid. You know it.

b: ^Then what? You want your son to chip in too? He’s still in school!
^Don’t forget, you have to declare your son’s income if you want him to help.
^If it goes over the income cap, we lose our subsidy.
^Your son just said he isn’t earning a stable income. And he’s still a student. How is it fair on him to shoulder the fees?
^Stupid. Why did I go bluff him about my income.
^Your son said he isn’t even earning yet. You want him to stop focusing on his studies to look for a job? That’s selfish to the boy right?
^Stupid. Why did I go bluff him about my income.

zhihao_1_3: ^I’ll think of something. Don’t bring my son into this.
^It’s doable for me if I go pro. I'm almost good enough already.
^I just need to push myself harder.
zhihao_1_4_narration: ^When I’m not streaming, I'm playing every night. I play this first-person shooter game called Alphas.
^It's a multiplayer game so I team up with other players. Also got high-skill ceiling so I don’t have limits on improving.
^Last time I always play with Gavin and Aman. Gavin I met on Discord first, then we found out we’re from the same JC.
^After that right, we always eat bak chor mee (minced pork noodles) together when we share tutorial break.
^He eat so much until his IGN (in-game name) also become ‘bakchormee’, lol.
^Now I can’t remember how long ago all of us played together.
^But if you don't ask then you also don’t know right?
